title: How to Build Business Credit in 90 Days (Complete Guide)
excerpt: The step-by-step blueprint that thousands of entrepreneurs have used to establish strong business credit profiles - even starting from scratch.
content:
Building business credit is one of the most powerful moves you can make as an entrepreneur. It separates your personal finances from your business, protects your assets, and opens doors to funding you never thought possible.

Why Business Credit Matters

Business credit allows you to:

  • Access capital without using personal credit
  • Qualify for higher credit limits
  • Build credibility with vendors and suppliers
  • Protect your personal assets
  • Scale faster with leverage

The 90-Day Blueprint

Phase 1: Foundation (Days 1-30)

Start by establishing your business legally and getting your foundational documents in order:

  1. Form your LLC or Corporation - Choose the right structure for your business
  2. Get an EIN - Your business tax ID from the IRS (free)
  3. Open a business bank account - Separate your finances completely
  4. Get a business phone number - Use a dedicated line for your business
  5. Build your business website - Even a simple one-page site works

Phase 2: Vendor Accounts (Days 31-60)

Now start building your credit file with vendor accounts that report to business credit bureaus:

  1. Uline - Office supplies with Net-30 terms
  2. Quill - Office supplies, reports to D&B
  3. Grainger - Industrial supplies
  4. Crown Office Supplies - Easy approval
  5. Southeastern Emergency Equipment - Reports to all bureaus

Pro Tip: Make small purchases and pay ON TIME. Payment history is everything!

Phase 3: Fleet Cards & Bigger Credit (Days 61-90)

Once you have 3-5 vendor accounts reporting, you can qualify for:

  • Fleet Cards - Chevron, Shell, BP (report to business bureaus)
  • Store Credit Cards - Home Depot, Lowe's, Amazon Business
  • Starter Business Credit Cards - Build stronger credit profile

Common Mistakes to Avoid

Don't make these errors that slow down your progress:

  • ❌ Mixing personal and business expenses
  • ❌ Missing payments or paying late
  • ❌ Not monitoring your business credit reports
  • ❌ Using your SSN instead of EIN for applications
  • ❌ Maxing out credit lines

Track Your Progress

Monitor your business credit with the three major bureaus:

  • Dun & Bradstreet (D&B) - Get your DUNS number (free)
  • Experian Business - Business credit reports
  • Equifax Business - Business credit monitoring

Next Steps

Building business credit is a journey, not a sprint. Stay consistent, pay on time, and watch your credit profile grow. Within 90 days, you'll have a foundation that can help you access tens of thousands in funding.

author: Antonio Cook
